quotes.quoteText: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
I think therefore I am.
Hell is other people.
Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
Without music, life would be a mistake.

The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.
Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company.
A day without laughter is a day wasted.
Have you ever noticed how ‘What the hell’ is always the right decision to make?
How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be.
May you live every day of your life.
You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts.
Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is.
It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!
If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?
Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
here is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible.
There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.

Simplicity, patience, compassion.
 These three are your greatest treasures.
 Simple in actions and thoughts, you return to the source of being.
 Patient with both friends and enemies,
 you accord with the way things are.
 Compassionate toward yourself,
 you reconcile all beings in the world.
Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science.
Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.
You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.

Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!
We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.
The past has no power over the present moment.
Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
quotes.source: The Hitchhicker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.quoteText:
A truth that's told with bad intent
 Beats all the lies you can invent.
The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.

You only live twice:
 Once when you're born
 And once when you look death in the face.
Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter
quotes.source: Ode on a Grecian Urn and Other Poems

quotes.quoteText: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.
The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
I was within and without. Simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.
A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
Nothing, Everything, Anything, Something: If you have nothing, then you have everything, because you have the freedom to do anything, without the fear of losing something.
quotes.source: This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...

quotes.quoteText: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.

I must say a word about fear. It is life's only true opponent. Only fear can defeat life. It is a clever, treacherous adversary, how well I know. It has no decency, respects no law or convention, shows no mercy. It goes for your weakest spot, which it finds with unnerving ease. It begins in your mind, always ... so you must fight hard to express it. You must fight hard to shine the light of words upon it. Because if you don't, if your fear becomes a wordless darkness that you avoid, perhaps even manage to forget, you open yourself to further attacks of fear because you never truly fought the opponent who defeated you.
We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.
The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear.

It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
quotes.source: The Complete Prose Works of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quoteText: Sometimes I lie awake at night and I ask, "Is life a multiple choice test or is it a true or false test?" ...Then a voice comes to me out of the dark and says, "We hate to tell you this but life is a thousand word essay."
I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think
It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
quotes.source: The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quotes.quoteText:
"You didn't kill him. He would have killed you, but you didn't kill him."
"So? He was stupid. If I killed everyone who was stupid, I wouldn't have time to sleep."
quotes.source: In the Hand of the Goddess
